Define Documentation

#define Apoxi_SvgConfig_hpp
 

#define SVG_ANTI_ALIAS_LEVEL   2
 

SVG_ANTI_ALIAS_LEVEL the number of samples used by the anti alias algorithm, 2 = 4 samples, 3 = 9 samples and so on. Lower values increase performance but makes less attractive results.

#define SVG_BYTES_PER_PIXEL   2
 

SVG_BYTES_PER_PIXEL is the number of bytes used to store a pixel in our native representation. This value cannot be altered just like that since it is platform dependent.

#define SVG_DEBUG
 

Uncomment SVG_DEBUG to enable debugging. A whole lot of debugging is controled in SvgDebug.hpp see that for mote details.

#define SVG_FONT_ANTI_ALIAS_LEVEL   3
 

#define SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_FFS   ((SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE) ^ 0x01)
 

#define SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_FFS_FILENAME   L"svg_font_file.svgz"
 

#define SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE   0x01
 

We are present two options when it comes to the storage of SVG font files. Either the SVG font data is stored on the flash files system (FFS) preferably as a .svgz file. The other alternative is to store the font file as a part of the program code.

To enable FFS storage, and disable code inline behaviour, set SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE to 0x00 To enable code inline, and disable FFS storage behaviour, set SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE to 0x01 There is no need to alter the value of SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_FFS since this value is the complement value to SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE. depending on what choice of resource you have made please define SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE_FILENAME and SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_FFS_FILENAME properly.

#define SVG_FONT_RESOURCE_INLINE_FILENAME   "fonts.hpp"
 

#define SVG_FONT_USE_SYSTEM_FONT   0
 

#define SVG_LARGEST_IMAGE_SIZE   153600
 

In order save memory large inline images are scaled down before rendered if they contain more pixels than SVG_LARGEST_IMAGE_SIZE

#define SVG_NUMBER_OF_ZOOMLEVELS   31
 

#define SVG_PLAYER_DEFAULT_HEIGHT   128
 

#define SVG_PLAYER_DEFAULT_WIDTH   128
 

In some cases SVG documents have no width or height or these are of relative nature expressed as a percentage value. In such cases we use a default width and height. Alter these values to anything you like as long as they are greater than 0.

#define SVG_SMALLEST_PREFERED_MEM_CHUNK_SIZE   16384
 

This value is set to the smallest memory chunk we try to allocate on behalf of the SVG rendering engine. Don't alter this value unless you know what you are doing. In the current implemetaiton see: SvgDecoder::Callback_Malloc for more details.

#define SVG_VIRTUAL_HEAP   0
